posts.post_content: I don't know I like it, I have been a big fan of acidic slime type effects if for no other reason than I can stack my deck with more creatures instead of naturalizes. It does percisely what green should do, which is mess with enchantments and artifacts. I don't see it as actually being that good against planeswalkers though, simply because it comes down a few turns later and at that point they've already used their planeswalker several times. Better than letting them continue with it for the rest of the game though.

Posted By: creepycrawler (6/24/2011 8:32:39 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is really destructive in EDH. Two of the best possible options for the format are available for 6 mana, and it gets you an extra creature. Potential combos abound with the first ability (e.x. drop it after [Garruk's Packleader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk's Packleader) for instance to get it in hand), and the second one is EDH gold.   
  
On top of it all it works beautifully with Naya colors so you can blink it with [Venser, the Sojourner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser, the Sojourner) or other options to basically take over the game.
posts.html:
This is really destructive in EDH. Two of the best possible options for the format are available for 6 mana, and it gets you an extra creature. Potential combos abound with the first ability (e.x. drop it after Garruk's Packleader for instance to get it in hand), and the second one is EDH gold.

On top of it all it works beautifully with Naya colors so you can blink it with Venser, the Sojourner or other options to basically take over the game.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: SeiberTross (6/16/2011 7:39:29 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Why is this rated so much lower than [Mold Shambler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mold Shambler)?  
  
Both are green 3/3s, both cost 6, both remove a noncreature permanent. But the exarch can tutor you a creature, remove a destruction-resistant permanent ([Spine of Ish Sah](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spine of Ish Sah)?), and works with [Mimic Vat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mimic Vat) and other combo pieces. It's even easier to splash.  
  
The only real advantage Mold Shambler has is the option not to pay its kicker, and I didn't think people liked [Hill Giant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hill Giant) that much.
posts.html:
Why is this rated so much lower than Mold Shambler?

Both are green 3/3s, both cost 6, both remove a noncreature permanent. But the exarch can tutor you a creature, remove a destruction-resistant permanent (Spine of Ish Sah?), and works with Mimic Vat and other combo pieces. It's even easier to splash.

The only real advantage Mold Shambler has is the option not to pay its kicker, and I didn't think people liked Hill Giant that much.

posts.post_content:
Think of the possibilities with this and birthing pod, lots of 5 CMC creatures can sac into this bloke. Then just sac him for a chancellor or something, so many options. Its the choice that makes this card golden, you get whatever creature you feel like next turn or you get to bury whatever is most annoying. Nasty creature, artifact, planeswalker or those evil equipments I hate so much...
  
   
If people are giving this card a 3 cuz its 6cmc, get over yourselves. Just gotta think outside the box. Like always.
